intro: Diodia physotricha var. cyclophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf diodia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
